As of our conversation, the Boston Bruins' current record against their Atlantic Division opponents is strong. They've had success against most teams in the division, but like any team, they've had their struggles against certain opponents.

Against their Atlantic Division foes, the Bruins have a winning record, with a few notable exceptions. They've had some tough matchups against the Toronto Maple Leafs, who are always a tough opponent, and the Tampa Bay Lightning, who are a perennial powerhouse in the division.

Specifically, the Bruins have struggled against the Lightning, who have given them trouble in a few games this season. The Lightning's high-powered offense, led by stars like Nikita Kucherov and Brayden Point, has been a challenge for the Bruins' defense to contain.

The Bruins have also had some close games against the Florida Panthers, who have been a surprise team in the division this season. The Panthers' speed and skill have given the Bruins' defense some fits, and they've had to work hard to come out on top in those matchups.

On the other hand, the Bruins have had success against the Montreal Canadiens, who have struggled this season. They've been able to take advantage of the Canadiens' inconsistent play and have come out on top in most of their matchups.

Against the other teams in the division, the Bruins have had a solid record, with a mix of wins and losses. They've been able to adapt to different playing styles and have come out on top more often than not.

Keep in mind that the NHL season is long, and teams can go through hot and cold streaks. The Bruins will need to continue to play consistent hockey and make adjustments as needed to stay atop the division and prepare for the playoffs.
